Detailed Description

Wrapper around the cell parameter collection to facilitate the access.

Create a simple wrapper to easily access the cell parameters from the LCCollection.

Exceptions:
DataNotAvailableException if the cell paramter collection does not access.

Member Function Documentation

const CellParameter CALICE::CellParameterAccess::getCellParameter ( UInt_t  index  )  const [inline]

Get the cell parameters of the specified cell (read only).

Parameters:
index the internal index of the cell (combination of module and cell index).
Returns:
a reference of the cell parameters (read only access). The internal index is composed of an offset, which depends on the module, to which the cell index is added.

Get the cell parameters of the specified cell (read/write).

Parameters:
index the internal index of the cell (combination of module and cell index).
Returns:
a reference of the cell parameters (read/write access). The internal index is composed of an offset, which depends on the module, to which the cell index is added.

UInt_t  cell_index 
) const [inline]

Get the cell parameters of the specified cell (read only).

Parameters:
module_index the index of the module (starting from zero).
cell_index the index of the cell on the specified module (starting from zero).
Returns:
a reference of the cell parameters (read only access).

UInt_t CALICE::CellParameterAccess::getIndex ( UInt_t  module_index,
UInt_t  cell_index 
) const [inline]

Get the cell index for the given module and cell index.

If the code was compiled with BOUNDARY_CHECK defined an exception is thrown if the module index or cell index is larger than the number of modules.or cells.

UInt_t CALICE::CellParameterAccess::getIndexOffset ( UInt_t  module_index  )  const [inline]

Get the index of the first cell of the given module.

If the code was compiled with BOUNDARY_CHECK defined an exception is thrown if the module index is larger than the number of modules.
